gurmukhi: ਬੇਸ੍ਵਾ ਕੇ ਸਿੰਗਾਰ ਬਿਭਚਾਰ ਕੋ ਨ ਪਾਰਾਵਾਰ ਬਿਨ ਭਰਤਾਰ ਨਾਰਿ ਕਾ ਕੀ ਕੈ ਬੁਲਾੲੀਅੈ
transliteration: Baysvaa Kay Singaar Bibhachaar Ko N Paaraavaara , Bin Bharataar Naari Kaa Kee Kai Bulaaeeai ?
translation: For immoral acts, there is no end for a whore to do up her ornamentation and embellishment. But without a husband, whose wife would she be called as?

gurmukhi: ਬਗ ਸੇਤ ਗਾਤ ਜੀਵ ਘਾਤ ਕਰਿ ਖਾਤ ਕੇਤੇ ਮੋਨ ਗਹੇ ਪ੍ਰਯਾਨਾ ਧਰੇ ਜੁਗਤ ਨ ਪਾੲੀਅੈ
transliteration: Bag Sayt Gaat Jeev Ghaat Kari Khaat Kaytay , Mon Gahay Pyaanaa Dharay Jougat N Paaeeai ?
translation: The looks of a heron are like that of a swan but it kills many living beings to eat them up. He silently sits in contemplation but such contemplation cannot reach one to the Lord.

gurmukhi: ਡਾਂਡ ਕੀ ਡੰਡਾੲੀ ਬੁਰਵਾੲੀ ਨ ਕਹਿਤ ਅਾਵੈ ਅਤਿ ਹੀ ਢਿਠਾੲੀ ਸੁਕੁਚਤ ਨ ਲਜਾੲੀਅੈ
transliteration: Daand Kee Dandaaee Buravaaee N Kahit Aavai , Ati Hee Ddhitthaaee Soukouchat N Lajaaeeai ?
translation: The shameless words and foul acts of a Bhand (low caste persons who entertain people on their happy functions) are beyond description. Due to their extreme impudence, they never feel shy of saying and doing anything.

gurmukhi: ਤੈਸੇ ਪਰ ਤਨ ਧਨ ਦੂਖਨਾ ਤ੍ਰਿਦੇਖ ਮਮ ਪਤਿਤ ਅਨੇਕ ੲੇਕ ਰੋਮ ਨ ਪੁਜਾੲੀਅੈ ॥੬੪੧॥
transliteration: Taisay Par Tan Dhan Dookhanaa Tridaykh Mama , Patit Anayk Ayk Rom N Pujaaeeai ?641?
translation: Similarly, like the incurable and deadly disease, I am infested with the ailments of looking at other's woman, other's wealth and slander. Sins of every hair of my body are more intense than the myriad sins of many sinners.
